dog boots that didn't suck

July 15, 2025 field-notes gear dogs

finally. boots that stayed on.

where i am

location: trail, post-hike debrief.
conditions: hot enough to matter.
energy level: satisfied. dogs tired. boots still on.

what i’m working with

the problem: hot pavement, sharp rocks, one dog who loses boots like it’s her job.

tried a lot of boots. most ended up in the trail dust within the first quarter mile.

what actually worked

Dog Mocs

  • stayed on (the bar is low, but still)
  • decent grip
  • not stiff
  • held up on rocks and heat

not perfect. nothing is. but these didn’t end up as expensive trail litter.

what i noticed

  • the strap system actually matters more than the boot itself
  • sizing is accurate—measure twice
  • they still looks at me like i’ve betrayed them when i put them on

tiny adjustments

  • do more of: just putting them on even when I get the look.
  • do less of: buying boots based on cute colors.
  • try next: maybe socks underneath for the drama queen paws.

field note filed. boots stayed on. calling it a win.
